fields.description:
steps to reproduce:
- run an instance and attach a volume
- migrate instance
- detach volume

Effects:
- CLC still reports that volume is attached
- volume disappears from inside instance
- iscsi session is cleared properly from NC

nc.log shows the following errors:
{noformat}
2013-05-10 04:38:56 ERROR 000009872 libvirt_err_handler      | libvirt: internal error Invalid harddisk device name: unknown,requested:vdb (code=1)
2013-05-10 04:38:56 ERROR 000009872 doDetachVolume           | [i-DFBD4026][vol-EDA73F8A] failed to detach host device '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_000a0001' from guest device 'vdb'
2013-05-10 04:38:56 ERROR 000009872 doDetachVolume           | [i-DFBD4026][vol-EDA73F8A] virDomainDetachDevice() or 'virsh detach' failed (err=-1) XML='<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<disk type="block">
  <driver cache="none" name="qemu"/>
  <source dev="/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-1IET_000a0001"/>
  <target bus="virtio" dev="unknown,requested:vdb"/>
</disk>
'
{noformat}

on clc, cloud-output.log shows the following error,
{noformat}
2013-05-10 04:38:58 ERROR | java.lang.RuntimeException: com.eucalyptus.util.async.FailedRequestException: Cluster response includes _return=false:DetachVolumeResp
onseType:null:return=false:epoch=null:status=ERROR
{noformat}

on SC, cloud-output.log shows the following,
{noformat}
2013-05-10 04:38:57  INFO | Processing UnexportVolume request for volume vol-EDA73F8A from node 10.111.5.10 with iqn iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:1f12dcf9dce2
2013-05-10 04:38:57  INFO | Unexporting volume vol-EDA73F8A from all clients
2013-05-10 04:38:57  INFO | Unexporting volume vol-EDA73F8A
2013-05-10 04:38:57  INFO | Attempting to unexport target: 10
2013-05-10 04:38:58  INFO | Done cleaning up: vol-EDA73F8A
{noformat}
fields.summary: cannot detach volume after migrating instance with volume attached

comments.body:
For EBS backed instances the volumes goes from {{detaching}} to {{attached}}.

{noformat}
[root@c-16 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-0CB24038
VOLUME	vol-0CB24038	5		PARTI00	in-use	2013-05-10T13:22:13.952Z	standard	
ATTACHMENT	vol-0CB24038	i-727A3EC4	/dev/vdb	detaching	2013-05-10T13:23:02.182Z
[root@c-16 ~]# 
[root@c-16 ~]# 
[root@c-16 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-0CB24038
VOLUME	vol-0CB24038	5		PARTI00	in-use	2013-05-10T13:22:13.952Z	standard	
ATTACHMENT	vol-0CB24038	i-727A3EC4	/dev/vdb	attached	2013-05-10T13:23:02.182Z
{noformat}
Linking EUCA-6083, since this is an after effect of migration.

I know what is happening here. The localDev is not being set correctly after migration and that causes errors during cleanup. I will confer with Dmitrii on this one. Either of us can fix it, and he may have a couple of spare cycles.
Looking at this today. I know what the cause is.

Fixed with commit: 062f4808423076d6d78419e1f82a598d4317b0d3

Tested manually with KVM + DAS.

Run instance. Attach volume. Migrate. Detach.

Also tested with ebs-instance and added some stop/start with the migration as well. All successful.

[~shaon], I tried a migration and detach on your setup and it worked fine. I restarted all NCs before I tried it and I created a new instance and attached a new volume to it. I then migrated it and detached the volume and saw no errors in the logs on the NC and the volume state was correct.

Please continue testing it and if you see any failures let me know. I will not consider this fixed until you are seeing success on every attempt.

Hi Zach.

I did a fresh install on the QA system and seeing this issue.

Package: {{eucalyptus-nc-3.3.0-0.0.975.20130519git829d8636.el6.x86_64}}
Commit: {{829d8636b9fc146a3215c473d940315057590a55}}

Logs are attached.

{{nc_success.tar.gz}} contains the logs where the detach works perfectly and this instance was not migrated.
{noformat}
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-D876406D	1		PARTI00	in-use	2013-05-20T12:01:41.313Z	standard	
ATTACHMENT	vol-D876406D	i-BBDB38C3	/dev/vdb	detaching	2013-05-20T12:25:28.260Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-D876406D	1		PARTI00	available	2013-05-20T12:01:41.313Z	standard
{noformat}

{{nc_failed.tar.gz}} contains the logs where the tested instance was migrated to and detach was failing.
{noformat}
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-detach-volume vol-D876406D
ATTACHMENT	vol-D876406D	i-7DD4435C	/dev/vdb	detaching	2013-05-20T12:02:26.779Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-D876406D	1		PARTI00	in-use	2013-05-20T12:01:41.313Z	standard	
ATTACHMENT	vol-D876406D	i-7DD4435C	/dev/vdb	attached	2013-05-20T12:02:26.779Z
{noformat}

I rebooted the NCs, and tried again. But it failed with same error.

I tested the same operation on your setup, Shaon, and it worked just fine. I did not restart or reboot any services.

Here is what I did:

{code}
euca-run-instance emi-8E8C3E0A -n 1 -t m1.small -k sshlogin
euca-create-volume -s 1 -z PARTI00
...wait for completion of instance and volume... got instance i-88373EAB and volume vol-32C73FB4
euca-attach-volume -i i-88373EAB -d /dev/vdb vol-32C73FB4
...wait for attachment to complete...
euca-migrate-instance -i i-88373EAB
...wait for migration to finish...
euca-detach-volume vol-32C73FB4
...wait...success..
{code}

If you were doing something else, or the same thing and saw failure we need to look more, but I'm just not able to reproduce the problem. You will have to use a new instance and new volume attachment for the test. If the instance was running before upgrade then it would likely have failed.

Hi Zach.

Vic and I were looking into the issue and this is what we've found so far,

The volume detachment fails after migration when we use _*-d vdb*_ as device name,
{noformat}
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-attach-volume -i i-ACC14781 -d vdb vol-4A6F3A97
ATTACHMENT	vol-4A6F3A97	i-ACC14781	vdb	attaching	2013-05-21T02:21:14.429Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-4A6F3A97	2		PARTI00	in-use	2013-05-21T02:14:20.993Z	standard	
ATTACHMENT	vol-4A6F3A97	i-ACC14781	/dev/vdb	attached	2013-05-21T02:21:14.440Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.15
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-detach-volume vol-4A6F3A97
ATTACHMENT	vol-4A6F3A97	i-ACC14781	/dev/vdb	detaching	2013-05-21T02:21:14.440Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-4A6F3A97	2		PARTI00	in-use	2013-05-21T02:14:20.993Z	standard	
ATTACHMENT	vol-4A6F3A97	i-ACC14781	/dev/vdb	attached	2013-05-21T02:21:14.440Z
{noformat}

The volume detachment succeeds when we use _*-d /dev/vdb*_ as device name,
{noformat}
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-attach-volume -i i-ACC14781 -d /dev/vdb vol-4A6F3A97
ATTACHMENT	vol-4A6F3A97	i-ACC14781	/dev/vdb	attaching	2013-05-21T02:15:03.942Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-4A6F3A97	2		PARTI00	in-use	2013-05-21T02:14:20.993Z	standard	
ATTACHMENT	vol-4A6F3A97	i-ACC14781	/dev/vdb	attached	2013-05-21T02:15:03.953Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-migrate-instances --source 10.111.5.41
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-detach-volume vol-4A6F3A97
ATTACHMENT	vol-4A6F3A97	i-ACC14781	/dev/vdb	detaching	2013-05-21T02:15:03.953Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-4A6F3A97
VOLUME	vol-4A6F3A97	2		PARTI00	in-use	2013-05-21T02:14:20.993Z	standard	
ATTACHMENT	vol-4A6F3A97	i-ACC14781	/dev/vdb	detaching	2013-05-21T02:15:03.953Z
[root@h-10 ~]# euca-describe-volumes vol-4A6F3A97
VOLUME	vol-4A6F3A97	2		PARTI00	available	2013-05-21T02:14:20.993Z	standard
{noformat}

Found with Shaon that he was using 'vdb' on attach rather than '/dev/vdb', this exposed a case that wasn't previously handled. I also tested against AWS and EC2 allows the shortened device name.

I added a fix, tested, and committed to 'testing' branch. Should be resolved.

Fixed. Tested with both Ephemeral and EBS-backed instances.

Thanks Zach.
